title: Binomial Theorem
text: Recollect the definition of the binomial theorem which gives us sum{k\=0}{n}{nCk*x**{n-k}*y**k} for the binomial expansion $$\left(x+y\right)^n$$

title: Relevant term
text: How can we use the summation formula for the binomial expansion to find the term required in the given expansion. Observe that the powers of $$x$$ decrease from $$n$$ to and the powers of $$y$$ increase from $$0$$ to $$n$$ as we go from the first to last term of the binomial expansion. Using this observation, what is the number of the term are we looking for?

title: nCr
text: Recollect the definition of choosing a combination of $$r$$ objects out of $$n$$ objects. This is denoted nCr $$=$$ n!/((n-r)!*r!)

title: Factorial
text: Recollect the definition of a factorial, $$n!$$ $$=$$ $$n \left(n-1\right) ...1$$, so we have $$n!$$ $$=$$ n*(n-1)!

title: Final answer
text: Using the formula for a combination and the properties of factorial what is the final answer?
